Name: Group Statue of Tuthmosis the First
Description: This famous group statue portrays King Tuthmosis the First, Queen Ahmose (mother of Hatshepsut), and the God Amun-Re sitting on a bench with entwined arms. Tuthmosis the First is holding a cloth and resting on his right thigh with his left hand behind Amun-Re, who is holding the Ankh sign of life in his right hand. Amun-Re's left hand is behind Ahmose, whose right hand stretches behind Amun-Re.
